meanings.definition: To fill or close seams or crevices with a waterproof filler or sealant.
meanings.sent1: I will cauk the gaps in the window to keep the rain out.
meanings.sent2: The handyman decided to cauk the bathtub to prevent leaks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to cauk the hole in the tree with acorns, thinking they would seal it.
meanings.sent4: She cauked her heart after the breakup, not letting any emotions leak out.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to cauk his suit before going into space to ensure no air escaped.

meanings.definition: A waterproof filler or sealant used to fill or close seams or crevices.
meanings.sent1: The cauk was essential for repairing the boat and keeping it afloat.
meanings.sent2: She bought a tube of cauk to fix the cracks in the wall.
meanings.sent3: The children mistook the cauk for playdough and tried to mold it into shapes.
meanings.sent4: His words acted as a cauk, sealing the bond between them forever.
meanings.sent5: The ancient tomb was preserved by the cauk applied by skilled craftsmen.
